businessProfile.name: Antica Forma
businessProfile.address: 267 N Main St, Moab, UT 84532, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 267 N Main St, Moab, UT 84532, USA

reviews.text:
A true taste of Italy in the heart of Utah!
As an Italian, I can confidently say that Pizzeria Antica Forma serves some of the best pizza I‚Äôve had outside of Italy. The pizzas are absolutely excellent ‚Äì generously topped with authentic Italian ingredients and perfectly cooked with just the right balance of crispiness and tenderness. You can truly taste the quality and care in every bite.

The staff was also incredibly friendly and welcoming, with warm smiles and great service that made the experience even more enjoyable. If you‚Äôre looking for real Italian pizza made the right way, this is the place to go. Highly recommended!

As a pizza enthusiast, I was excited to try this Neapolitan spot in Moab. While it's decent for a casual meal, it falls short of its authentic claims.The main letdown was the crust. The dough itself had promise but was under-fermented, resulting in a base that was pale and soft. The real issue, however, was in the stretch. It was stretched poorly, making the cornicione (the rim) incredibly dense and doughy instead of light, airy, and crisp. I have added an example picture of how the crust should be on a properly fermented and stretched dough below. Toppings were also imbalanced‚Äîmy prosciutto pizza had just four small  slices of ham buried under a mountain of arugula. Service was just okay. Fine for a quick hungry bite but Pizza connoisseur will leave disappointed.

We started with the burrata appetizer; the cheese was served with cherry tomatoes, basil and balsamic glaze. I had a pepperoni and mushroom pizza, my wife had Margherita pizza. The crust is thin and you know it is wood fired. While the pizza was good, it was served on a cold dish so it cooled quickly. The restaurant was loud; about 1/3 of the tables inside were occupied.

Food is amazing and well described on menu.  Service was by a team who catered to our needs without stepping on the toes of our server.  Atmosphere allowed for conversation.  I asked for garlic and they asked roasted or fresh?, showing expertise and dedication to getting it right.  I‚Äôd eat here six times a year if I lived here.

Amazing experience at Antica Forma! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîauthentic, fresh, and full of flavor. Despite the restaurant being packed, the service was impressively fast and efficient. We had a short 15-minute wait, but it was well worth it. Everything from the atmosphere to the quality of the pizza made this a fantastic dining experience. Will definitely be back next time we‚Äôre in Moab!

detailedReviews.author: rob salkowski
detailedReviews.text: Great food, and waitress was friendly. Quite expensive but that's Moab ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

detailedReviews.author: Good Moab
detailedReviews.text:
I'm sorry I have no photos to contribute tonight.
I have eaten here several times. This includes eating in and also ordering out.
This is the Italian restaurant that I refer my guests at a local motel that I work a front desk position.

Unfortunately, tonight was a disappointment. First of all, it took a long time for them to answer their phone for me to order a pizza to go.

When I got there, the restaurant was completely empty. I saw many workers just sitting at tables.

I told reception that I thought it was not good, not seeing people in the restaurant on a Friday night.
She agreed with my comment and I told her that I would continue to recommend people from my motel to go to Antica Forma.

Well........

I kind of changed my mind when I got my pizza and came home which is only one minute away, and the pizza was cold!

It wasn't proportioned as the funghu pizza like it is supposed to be. I know this, because I have had it before.

I just want to say I'm truly disappointed, and I think management really needs to look at this review.
I really want you to succeed!

detailedReviews.author: Dario Bartolo
detailedReviews.text: Da napoletano posso dire che fa un'ottima pizza. Complimenti!

detailedReviews.author: Daniel Olivier
detailedReviews.text: Food is good, but it is very expensive.

detailedReviews.author: Alpaslan Osman Ya≈üar
detailedReviews.text:
We arrived at this place at 9:32 PM, even though it clearly shows closing time as 10:00 PM. They told us they couldn‚Äôt serve us because they were already ‚Äúclosed.‚Äù Meanwhile, pizzas were still being made inside. The person who claimed to be the manager didn‚Äôt even bother to speak to us.

We explained that we just wanted to order takeout and leave ‚Äî at first, they said ‚Äúokay,‚Äù but then changed their mind and refused. When we mentioned that we had driven 30 minutes based on their posted hours, the response was simply, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs not my problem.‚Äù

Such unprofessional, careless, and disrespectful behavior is unacceptable. One of the worst customer service experiences I‚Äôve ever had. Definitely not recommended.

Such a shame!!!

detailedReviews.author: Natalia Rodriguez
detailedReviews.text:
We are tourists visiting Moab and decided to try this restaurant. The food was good, but unfortunately the service was very disappointing.

My husband is still practicing his English, and while he was trying to order something simple like a lemonade, our server made faces that made us feel very uncomfortable. Throughout our meal, she only came once to ask if we needed anything, while we noticed she interacted much more positively with other tables around us.

I do speak English and tried to place the orders myself, but she continued to act as if she didn‚Äôt understand me. She even brought the wrong number of lemonades and kept making unpleasant gestures during her interactions with us.

This was the first time I have felt this way in the U.S., and it truly made the experience negative. We chose to leave only a minimal tip, as we didn‚Äôt feel the service deserved more. I almost never leave bad reviews, but in this case I feel it is deserved.

I don‚Äôt remember her name, but she was an older woman with curly platinum hair.

detailedReviews.author: Mary Byrd
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza! The Pizza dough was exceptional! Friendly service

detailedReviews.author: c c
detailedReviews.text:
New favorite.  Very similar to authentic pizza in Italy.  If you're looking for a typical pizza joint in America, don't come here. The crust was perfect, simple, and homemade.  Delicious combinations of high-quality ingredients.  Wood burning stove added that authentic tasty natural smoke to the pizza.  Our waiter Juan was fast and helpful.  Also tried their cheesecake and banana cream pie.  Both homemade and some of the best desserts I've had in a long time!  For not being hungry, I over ate on this trip.  Well worth it.  Will be back!

Didn't lie.  We were back. And it was well worth it.  Thanks again for the great service and amazing food!

detailedReviews.author: Grace K
detailedReviews.text: So good!! Disappointed they don't have sangrias though. Food was awesome!

detailedReviews.author: Braden Melia
detailedReviews.text: As a pizza enthusiast, I was excited to try this Neapolitan spot in Moab. While it's decent for a casual meal, it falls short of its authentic claims.The main letdown was the crust. The dough itself had promise but was under-fermented, resulting in a base that was pale and soft. The real issue, however, was in the stretch. It was stretched poorly, making the cornicione (the rim) incredibly dense and doughy instead of light, airy, and crisp. I have added an example picture of how the crust should be on a properly fermented and stretched dough below. Toppings were also imbalanced‚Äîmy prosciutto pizza had just four small  slices of ham buried under a mountain of arugula. Service was just okay. Fine for a quick hungry bite but Pizza connoisseur will leave disappointed.

detailedReviews.author: Leona
detailedReviews.text: Sehr aufmerksamer Service. Absolut leckeres Essen. Authentisch italienische K√ºche. Sehr zu empfehlen

detailedReviews.author: Daniel Mendoza
detailedReviews.text: Awesome wood fired pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Dima Shalik
detailedReviews.text: Undercooked

detailedReviews.author: Domenico Sparvoli
detailedReviews.text:
Pizza come quella italiana.
Consigliato per una cena a moab

detailedReviews.author: Miranda U
detailedReviews.text: We went to Moab for our anniversary and wanted Italian food so we thought we‚Äôd try Antica Forma based on reviews. Man, did it fall short. The food was bland and basic and very overpriced. Service was average. No wonder it wasn‚Äôt busy.

detailedReviews.author: P Rex
detailedReviews.text: Really yummy pizzas, fast service

detailedReviews.author: Kim Young
detailedReviews.text: We ate dinner here on 8/17/25. I‚Äôll start with the good first. This pizza was really good. The bruschetta had great flavor but the bread was not toasted very well so was soggy. Had that been all this review would be a good review. However, it was disturbing to see all the staff sitting at tables scrolling their phones unless someone walked in, an order needed taken or delivered to a table, then right back to sitting at a table scrolling their phones. Phones are one of the dirtiest items and carry the most germs. The most disgusting thing was when one of the guys from the kitchen came out wearing his black food safety gloves, sat at a table and scrolled his phone and touched his chair with his gloves on, then went back into the kitchen area and began working again with the same gloves. Management needs to do some better training, especially on health and safety.

detailedReviews.author: Jordan S
detailedReviews.text: For the middle of nowhere - I did not except to have good pizza . This was some of the best pizza I‚Äôve ever had . Absolutely delicious- my husband got a pasta dish and also said it was amazing ! Great flavor would come back for sure !

detailedReviews.author: vAndrewOG
detailedReviews.text: Pizza molto buona, l‚Äôimpasto un p√≥ un cracker ma pomodoro e mozzarella molto buoni, ho mangiato pizze molto peggiori in Italia. Unica cosa pulite i bagni perch√® c‚Äô√® un odore sgradevole ed √® diventato uno zoo di insetti‚Ä¶

detailedReviews.author: Michela ‚ÄúMirea‚Äù Rea
detailedReviews.text:
Ottima pizza per essere a Moab‚Ä¶ fatta bene!
Leggermente gommosa ma molto napoletana rispetto a delle napoletane!
Insomma buona e non pesante! Nottata tranquilla!

detailedReviews.author: francesca mattich
detailedReviews.text:
Dopo 15 giorni di cibo tipo fast food avevamo voglia di cibo italiano. Abbiamo trovato la pizza buonissima (la nonna e il padrino) e anche i dessert (strawberry cake e carrot cake).
Consigliatissima.

detailedReviews.author: kim pulice
detailedReviews.text: This was a random stop for us traveling through Moab from Chicago. The pizza was delicious!!!!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Conor Sullivan
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was delicious and they gave some dough for our young boys to play with and they ended up making the dough they stretched into their own little pizzas, it was thrilling for them

detailedReviews.author: Collin Stoltzfus
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza. Good service and plenty of room for lunch. The outdoor seating area is a nice touch.

detailedReviews.author: Sebastien Schmitt
detailedReviews.text: Gr8 pizza, mozzarella sticks soooo good. Came here after an extremely bad experience at The Sunset Grill, avoid that place like the plague..Antica Forma WINNING

detailedReviews.author: Milagros Gago
detailedReviews.text: THE BEST PIZZA AND PASTA IN MOAB.

detailedReviews.author: Luigi Baggioli
detailedReviews.text: pizza davvero buona per essere negli stati uniti,  come mangiarla in italia!!

detailedReviews.author: Daniela Liang
detailedReviews.text: Real traditional Italian pizza. Pizzas were delicious and the service super fast. Not a fancy place but if you are looking for good pizza in town, that‚Äôs it! Highly recommended it!

detailedReviews.author: WG Zhang
detailedReviews.text: Don‚Äôt be fooled by the seemly good reviews. This restaurant had the worst food we have ever tried. Plus the waitress just does not seem to be happy working there.

detailedReviews.author: Craig Woodruff
detailedReviews.text: The server was trying her best but seemed to be the only one working when we visited. Wait times were long for a mostly empty restaurant. It's a shame because we were really excited to try it.

detailedReviews.author: Carson Nipper
detailedReviews.text: My kids and spouse enjoyed the pasta. I ordered the steak and it was a complete waste of money. The steak was mostly just fat and what little actual meat there was was flavorless and a gross texture. I ended up throwing 90% of it in the garbage.

detailedReviews.author: Ronald H
detailedReviews.text: Kann man durchaus hin in beiden Filialien

detailedReviews.author: Ariel Valle
detailedReviews.text: Excellent food and service. No wait time at 7:30pm. The pizzas, garlic rolls and chicken Alfredo were perfect. üëåüèº

detailedReviews.author: Guillaume GRANDJEAN
detailedReviews.text:
Parfait
Pizza tops

detailedReviews.author: Maelle Rapin
detailedReviews.text:
Prise de commande par t√©l√©phone tr√®s simple et peu d‚Äôattente en 15 min c‚Äô√©tait pr√™t

detailedReviews.author: Canyon Yama
detailedReviews.text: Worst food I‚Äôve had in a long time. Ordered a sausage calzone and it was filled with beef slices instead of sausage. Tried to return it and was turned away. Terrible food and worse customer service

detailedReviews.author: Jack Walter
detailedReviews.text: The food was pretty great here, just the environment and service wasn‚Äôt the next level necessary to be a 5 star.

detailedReviews.author: Simona Randone
detailedReviews.text: Pizza veramente buona, soffice ma croccante nei bordi, con salsa e mostrarlo di qualit√†. Siamo arrivati quasi alla ora di chiusura dopo un lungo Trail, e questa ottima pizza ci ha rigenerati! Peccato che nessuno parli italiano, nonostante il tricolore esposto

detailedReviews.author: Seanan Burke
detailedReviews.text: Really high quality pizza. The Il Tartufo was beyond delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Z.
detailedReviews.text: It's truly wonderful to find service that knows the menu, the ingredients in Neapolitan Dough and Napoli Salad. Shakira is Excellent!  She is well trained and communicates pleasant service. Your meat lovers pie was very tasty. One can only imagine how challenging it is to prevent dough from over proofing in Moab's summer heat. You've knocked it outta the park with leopard spots. Keep it fresh and keep it up.

detailedReviews.author: Jenna Rojas
detailedReviews.text: Delicious pizza & garlic bread with excellent service!

detailedReviews.author: Charlie Biondo
detailedReviews.text: We all had pasta and it was all delicious. Thanks for everything

detailedReviews.author: Star
detailedReviews.text:
The cheese bread was not good.
The pistachio pizza was phenomenal!
It was very busy and they seemed short staff, but Linda was very kind and extremely helpful.

detailedReviews.author: Jamie D
detailedReviews.text: Someone really and truly cares about the food this restaurant serves. Fresh, well sourced ingredients -- They make the mozzarella and many other things in house.

detailedReviews.author: Jessica
detailedReviews.text: We got the Pasta Primavera and it was ok. For $19 I was expecting better and bigger.  I did appreciate that I could see the menu and prices easily on the website. I will not eat here again while in Moab.

detailedReviews.author: Mark Elliott
detailedReviews.text: Antica Forma in Moab was a surprise in the best way. You don‚Äôt expect to find true Neapolitan-style pizza in the middle of red rock country, but that‚Äôs exactly what they‚Äôre serving‚Äîwood-fired, blistered crusts, quality ingredients, and just the right balance of chew and char. The atmosphere is laid-back and welcoming, with an open kitchen and casual seating that suits the desert setting. We shared a couple of pies and a salad, and everything was fresh and flavorful. The host was friendly, and while our server was efficient, they weren‚Äôt especially attentive. Still, it was a great meal and definitely worth a stop if you‚Äôre craving something satisfying after a day on the trails. And don‚Äôt skip dessert‚Äîthe in-house made cr√®me br√ªl√©e and strawberry shortcake were exceptional.

detailedReviews.author: Njl 250
detailedReviews.text: What a hidden gem in the middle of Moab, Utah! As someone from New York, my expectations for pizza are very high and this place did not disappoint! This was some of the best pizza I‚Äôve had outside of New York. We also had the burrata which tasted homemade and cheesy garlic bread that was delicious. It is amazing that such a place exists in a small town, and this is definitely a place I‚Äôd return to when I find myself in Moab again!

detailedReviews.author: A google user
detailedReviews.text: Service was very good and the pizza was outstanding! Dessert was excellent as well. We had the banana cream pie and crembrule - so good!

detailedReviews.author: Troy Eddy
detailedReviews.text: What a great menu. So many options that are all delish. The crazy thing and I don't know if this normal was the speed. Pizza were flying out. Delish.

detailedReviews.author: Mariana Mercado
detailedReviews.text: If in Moab, this pizza place is a must! Service is great, servers and hostess aver extremely friendly. They give your kids pizza dough to play with. The salad was delicious, perfect amount of dressing and fresh ingredients. The pizza was extremely flavorful.

detailedReviews.author: Riccardo Sganga
detailedReviews.text: Ottima pizza. Bisogna stare attenti che aggiungono automaticamente il 20% di mancia e poi nello scontrino ne chiedono anche una addizionale.

detailedReviews.author: Sean Dougherty
detailedReviews.text: Really good pizza and lots of gluten free pizza options

detailedReviews.author: Dana Dougherty
detailedReviews.text: Both regular pizza and gluten free were great. Do eat gf if you are celiac.  Definite cross containmation.   Expensive and they up charge for a change

detailedReviews.author: Vanessa Camanse-Wolf
detailedReviews.text: The whole staff is friendly and helpful.  Wish I had a whole day to look at everything.  They are well stocked and organized.

detailedReviews.author: The Grey Antler
detailedReviews.text: We had dinner at Antica Forma and while the food was good and our waitress was very nice the gray curly haired woman was awful.  As soon as we arrived she had a chip on her shoulder.  She asked if we wanted a bar menu.  We had never been asked that in all the years we‚Äôve ate out, which is many.  Usually restaurants just give it out with the food menu,  We then ordered our drinks and food and as I said our waitress was friendly, competent, and very good.  When it came time to leave, she brought the check in a timely manner.  She asked if we wanted a box but being we were heading to Salt Lake City next, we had to decline as we‚Äôll be on the road.  We paid, tipped and gathered our things and said good night.  As we were leaving, the manager or owner held the door open for my husband and then let it go and it started to close on my face.  Our waitress was standing behind her and said to me ‚Äúoh I‚Äôm so sorry she did that‚Äù!  This gray haired woman was very rude and definitely should not be in the restaurant business if things annoy her so much.

detailedReviews.author: James Bennett
detailedReviews.text:
Food was great! Guys managing the place & at front desk were great!

Service was mehhh. We only saw our waiter once. All other requests (refills, more food, desert) were all placed with whomever we could flag down nearby.

detailedReviews.author: Sharon Marlow
detailedReviews.text: We just left there.  The parking lot was empty at 4:30.  We thought maybe they were closed.  No real atmosphere to speak of.  A ton of staff who were absolutely wonderful!  I ordered chicken Parmesan.  The chicken part was fine.  The pasta sauce was similar to tomato juice.  It definitely lacked body and flavor.  I was very disappointed.  We ordered garlic toast which came out very quickly and was good and it was followed very quickly by my meal, my husband‚Äôs salad and our grandsons pizza.  The pizza was fine my husbands salad was bland . Our waitress was excellent as were the others who attended us.  I would not go back.

detailedReviews.author: Kimberly Felts
detailedReviews.text: Best Gluten Free Pizza! The crust was amazing. My husband loved his regular crust pizza also.

detailedReviews.author: Boxer Mama
detailedReviews.text: I absolutely love that they get you water as soon as you are set. It was a hot day and that was amazing. Food was fantastic.  We had garlic bread and Chicken Parmigina . Food was amazing. Restaurant itself was loud, but there were families,  so no worries. Service was fantastic and attentive.  What a great experience.

detailedReviews.author: SPP GMAIL
detailedReviews.text:
Surprised the rating is so low here.
I thought it was fantastic. Pizza was the real deal. Great cappuccino. Great cr√®me br√ªl√©e. It was an unexpected treat

detailedReviews.author: phabean
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza, fresh, crusty and tasty (living at the border to italy - so my expectations where low). But but, guys. Plastic menus that were sticky, tables and chairs wobbly and not clean. Food servers: fast but unfriendly and just offloading the plates - will not do the job. Please upgrade to the same level as the pizza!!

detailedReviews.author: Joe Bublitz
detailedReviews.text: Such good pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Julia X
detailedReviews.text: Un‚Äôottima pizza napoletana a Moab!!

detailedReviews.author: GC Stooo
detailedReviews.text: Lovely food, great service. We had pizza and pasta mains, fresh and tasty. Def recommend

detailedReviews.author: Sev Dishman
detailedReviews.text: True Italian...  excellent food

detailedReviews.author: Beckham Peebles
detailedReviews.text: Love this place Miguel is the best waiter

detailedReviews.author: Beckham Michie
detailedReviews.text: Loved the food and the waiter

detailedReviews.author: Eric Miller
detailedReviews.text: We loved our dinner experience. Our 8 year old had two kids‚Äôs cheese pizza. He says it beats Tony‚Äôs Pizza from North Beach in San Francisco, CA. The La Nonna was a delicious choice we made and paired it with a shared Caesar Salad. Also, my favorite beer on tap was Amber Ale.

detailedReviews.author: jim reynolds
detailedReviews.text: Second time I've been here in 2 years I will returning again. Awesome

detailedReviews.author: Twin Oaks
detailedReviews.text: A terrible experience. They automatic added 20% mandatory gratuities fee and no any notice in advance. Tips are common sense in US, but NOT in gratuities.  They should be clearly disclosed to the customer. Not trick on customers and visitors.

detailedReviews.author: Sandi Ford
detailedReviews.text:
Super meh all around.
Certainly better than the other pizza place in town, but it was all average at best (food/service/atmosphere).
For the price there are better options in town.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.1/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the authentic Napoli-style pizza and exceptional pizza dough, which is considered the best in Moab and reminiscent of Italy - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The wood-fired oven adds a natural smoky flavor that enhances the authenticity and taste of the pizzas, making it a standout feature - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The friendly and attentive service, particularly from staff like Juan, enhances the dining experience and encourages repeat visits - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues, particularly regarding poor customer service and inconsistent food quality - review management can address this concern
Long wait times and service inefficiencies, especially when the restaurant appears empty or understaffed - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Lack of atmosphere and ambiance awareness, as well as inconsistent service experiences - social media marketing can improve this area

Girelie app is killer!

positive.author: Doug Barton
positive.text: We went during the mid afternoon before it got too busy. Their appetizers are amazing and their pistachio basil pizza is the best. My only regret is that I don't live close to this place. This is a must visit place.

neutral.author: Jessica
neutral.text: We got the Pasta Primavera and it was ok. For $19 I was expecting better and bigger.  I did appreciate that I could see the menu and prices easily on the website. I will not eat here again while in Moab.

Fromage gras et tr√®s moyen.
Tout cela pour plus de 20‚Ç¨ sans compter taxe et tips..
Le serveur pas chaleureux.

negative.author: Chris Wise
negative.text: Call before going if close to close , arrived at 9:30 was told they were closed due to being  slow , counted over 20 people in outdoor seating and parking lot almost full  ‚Ä¶. Was looking forward to trying the pizza ‚Ä¶.

negative.author: Good Moab
negative.text:
I'm sorry I have no photos to contribute tonight.
I have eaten here several times. This includes eating in and also ordering out.
This is the Italian restaurant that I refer my guests at a local motel that I work a front desk position.

Unfortunately, tonight was a disappointment. First of all, it took a long time for them to answer their phone for me to order a pizza to go.

When I got there, the restaurant was completely empty. I saw many workers just sitting at tables.

I told reception that I thought it was not good, not seeing people in the restaurant on a Friday night.
She agreed with my comment and I told her that I would continue to recommend people from my motel to go to Antica Forma.

Well........

I kind of changed my mind when I got my pizza and came home which is only one minute away, and the pizza was cold!

It wasn't proportioned as the funghu pizza like it is supposed to be. I know this, because I have had it before.

I just want to say I'm truly disappointed, and I think management really needs to look at this review.
I really want you to succeed!

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
